ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He took a look at the stars
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then he looked up at the stars (they worshipped),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Then he looked carefully at the stars
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The people invited him to attend their feast). Then he looked at the stars
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He then shot a glance at the stars.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then he cast a glance at the stars,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then he looked at the stars, looking up once,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And he cast a glance at the stars,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And he glanced a glance at the stars
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: He looked up at the stars.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then he glanced a glance on the stars.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Then he made an observation of the stars
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then did he cast a glance at the Stars.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then he cast a glance at the stars (to deceive them),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He cast a glance at the stars
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then he took a glance at the stars.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And he cast a look at the stars
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:88] And he cast a glance at the stars — to delude them into thinking that he relies on them, so that they would then trust him —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And he glanced a glance at the stars) it is also said that this means: he reflected for a while,
